intro: Angostura nodosa, commonly known as the nodding angostura, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of South America. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers. The plant has a compact, shrub-like growth habit with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its unique feature is the nodding inflorescence, which gives it its common name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in marshy areas near rivers.
